Description: The Mockito Framework tests Java units. Developers can declare dependencies on the library, recommending Gradle as a build system. Interactions can be verified as well as stub method calls. Use Mockito to automate tests, sustain development, and minimize defects.

The Guzzle PHP Framework offers all the tools necessary for building RESTful web service clients. This Framework features PSR-7 based streams request and response bodies, persistent connections and parallel requests, plugins for OAuth and logging, and is powered by the Symfony2 EventDispatcher. Additionally, it supports both synchronous and asynchronous requests with the same interface, and client behavior constructs with a middleware system.

The Yawp Java Web Framework in REST architecture aims to provide productivity and scalability to create APIs. Features include query API, security shields, model hooks, asynchronous pipes, Google App Engine support, and PostgreSQL JsonB as manual scaling.
The WorkShare Ruby Framework by WorkShare helps developers to integrate file sharing features into applications. It includes functionality, configuration, and libraries.

Siesta is a framework for writing REST clients for iOS 8+ and macOS / OS X 10.11+. It provides a client-side cache of observable models for RESTful resources in order to simplify app code. Siesta is written in Swift, but supports apps in both Swift and Objective-C. This framework requires Xcode 7 and Swift 2.0.

Enyo is a JavaScript framework for building native-quality HTML5 apps. It can be used to develop apps for all major platforms, including phones, tablets, PCs, and TVs. Enyo is provided for free under the Apache 2 License.

Ruby on Rails Framework is a web framework that allows developers to construct database-supported applications as per the prescribed requirements of the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern. The knowledge of the MVC is a prerequisite for deploying the Ruby on Rails framework, considering that it splits the developer’s application into model layer, controller layer, and view layer. Whereas the model layer is the domain model that forms the backbone of the developer’s application, the controller layer processes relevant responses to inbound HTTP requests. The view layer, on the other hand, generates representations for resources related to the developer’s application.
Limoncello PHP framework is available for download and installation from Packagist. Additional models can be found on GitHub repository.

jQuery is a JavaScript framework that aims to simplify web design. It can be used in multiple browsers - including Internet Explorer, Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Opera - to add and manage elements, events, callbacks, and more. jQuery is CSS3 compliant.

Bootbox is a JavaScript Framework for creating programmatic dialog boxes using Bootstrap modals. It removes the burden of creating, managing, and removing the required DOM elements or JS event handlers from the user. This framework is offered under the MIT License.

Blueprint is a CSS framework that aims to provide web developers with a way to minimize design work. Blueprint's intent is to offer common CSS classes and other web design tools, so developers don't have to start from scratch. The framework proposes built-in grid layouts, typography, plugins, printing stylesheets, and IE browser compatibility while also working with most programming languages such as PHP and Ruby on Rails.

Garage is a Ruby on Rails framework that allows developers to add RESTful hypermedia APIs to their applications. It provides a descriptive way to serve both ActiveRecord models and Ruby objects as JSON-based resources.

The Apache Mesos JavaScript Framework by Tobilg provides a JavaScript language platform for constructing applications for Mesos HTTP APIs. Developers can deploy the framework in the development of applications for various APIs including Mesos Executor HTTP, Mesos Scheduler HTTP, and Mesos Operator HTTP APIs.

Hapi.js is a configuration-centric framework that allows developers to reuse application logic in a "highly modular and prescriptive approach". It offers built-in support for input validation, caching, authentication, and others. This framework is used to build enterprise-quality web applications and services.
The Kitura Framework by IBM allows developers to build applications on Bluemix with the aim to interact via Mac and Linux. It is web-based written on Swift language.
The Strapi Node.js Framework by Strapi helps developers to build back end applications and services. It includes installation, link to the Strapi studio, and resources to create a project.

The Nette PHP Framework simplifies the development of PHP websites. It fortifies the security of websites and enhances the overall performance of web development applications. The framework that is fully compatible with the PHP 7 requires the minimum of version 5.6.0 of the PHP language platform.

Cistern is a Ruby-based framework that was extracted from Fog. It is designed to help users build their API clients consistently and to facilitate building mock support. This framework has no dependencies.

The DeviantART Cocoa Framework by Sam Shull authenticates and uploads content to Stash, DeviantART upload and publishing platform. It includes a reference to Sparkle project, available at https://sparkle-project.org/

Eve is a Python framework that allows developers to build and deploy fully-featured RESTful web services. This framework is powered by Flask, Redis, Cerberus, and Events. It offers support for both MongoDB and SQL and has been tested with Python 2.6, 2.7, 3.3, 3.4, and PyPy.
The Comic Vine Ruby SDK by Patrick Sharp interacts with the API to access comic database functionalities. It provides installation and usage.
The Gbone JavaScript framework written on top of Backbone, intended for building mobile JavaScript applications. The framework aims to be dependent on Backbone, Underscore, and Zepto/jQuery.

The Vertabrae JavaScript framework's goal is to add overall structure to Backbone.js applications. Features intended to provide for developers include: Dynamic script loading, AMD module format, dependency management, build with largely open source libraries, organize code in packages, optimize and build for one or many single page apps, host on fully cached server, e.g. no server-side scripting using only an API for data, and behaviour driven development.

The Backbone Faux Serve is a framework that intended for mocking up server-side persistence / processing for Backbone.js. The goal of the framework is to override Backbone's native sync by triggering invoking a route's handler by using the syncing of a Model (or Collection) and its URL alongside the sync method. When a pair forms that matches a defined route, the route's handler is invoked.
Recognize.IM Objective-C SDK by Alessio Bassio interacts with the API to access image recognition capabilities, aiming to be useful in mobile integration. It includes a Cordova plugin.
The CloudCMS JavaScript SDK by CloudCMS integrates content management features via API. It offers content retrieval, cluster-wide caching and broadcasting, and tag processing.

Electron is a framework that helps developers write cross-platform desktop applications using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This framework is based on Node.js and Chromium. It is also used in the Atom editor.

The Luca framework intends to be a component architecture framework based on Backbone.js, which aims to include many development helpers, classes, patterns, and tools needed to build scalable and clean single page applications. It uses twitter Bootstrap compatible markup and CSS naming conventions with the goal to produce styled user interfaces with JSON alone.
